Extraction of Metals.description: The extraction and processing of raw metallic materials, such as aluminum and other metals used in the Pixel 6.
Extraction of Metals.rationale: These materials form the core structure of the device and are integral to its durability and sustainability.

Glass Manufacturing.description: Production of Corning Gorilla Glass Victus, which is utilized for the Pixel 6 screen and back protection.
Glass Manufacturing.rationale: Essential for device durability against scratches and other impacts.

Recycled Plastic Processing.description: Processing of recycled plastics used in the phone's body and packaging.

Logistics and Transportation.description: Transportation of raw materials to manufacturing facilities.
Logistics and Transportation.rationale: Necessary for the delivery of components to assembly lines.

Assembly of Device Components.description: The assembly process includes putting together the Google Tensor SoC, the camera module, and other critical system components.
Assembly of Device Components.rationale: Assembling is crucial for the formation of the final product.

Distribution Network.description: Movement of the final product from manufacturing facilities to retail and distribution centers worldwide.

N/A.description: No significant installation or setup required by the consumer beyond booting the device.
N/A.rationale: Smartphones do not require an installation process in the traditional sense.

Device Usage Lifecycle.description: Normal everyday use of the Pixel 6, including voice calls, apps, and photography.
Device Usage Lifecycle.rationale: Comprises the functional phase of the device's lifetime.

N/A.description: Routine maintenance such as software updates provided by Google.
N/A.rationale: No regular physical maintenance is required.

Screen and Battery Repairs.description: Repairs performed for damage or fault, such as screen replacement or battery repairs.
Screen and Battery Repairs.rationale: Important to assess device longevity and material cycling.

Component Replacement.description: Replacement of wearable parts, such as batteries or screens over the device's life.
Component Replacement.rationale: Helps in understanding the repairability and recycling aspects.

N/A.description: Factory refurbishment for resale remains minimal and is not typical for individual users.
N/A.rationale: Usually conducted at a large scale without direct consumer interaction.

Battery Consumption.description: The usage of battery power for operations, apps, and features.

N/A.description: No direct water utilization during the operational stage.
N/A.rationale: Water is not a requirement for smartphone operation.

N/A.description: Smartphones do not typically require de-construction as used in traditional applications.
N/A.rationale: Deinstallation is limited to personal possession transfer or resale.

E-Waste Logistics.description: Movement of old or broken devices to recycling or disposal facilities.
E-Waste Logistics.rationale: Critical for understanding waste management and recycling.

Component Recovery and Recycling.description: Recovery of valuable materials and recycling of components.

Landfill Disposal.description: Disposal of non-recyclable materials in landfills.
Landfill Disposal.rationale: Necessary for assessing the complete lifecycle and waste impact.
